Photos: Intriguing things owned by Russians around the world The Independent – Both The Independent, one of UK's daily national newspapers, and London's widely read freebie the Evening Standard are owned by Russian billionaire Alexander Lebedev.

Hide Caption 2 of 11

Photos: Intriguing things owned by Russians around the world Brooklyn Nets – Mikhail Prokhorov, Russia's metal tycoon, bought NBA team New Jersey Nets in 2009, built a new arena in New York City and rebranded the team as the Brooklyn Nets.

Photos: Intriguing things owned by Russians around the world Chelsea FC – Chelsea Football Club's owner, Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich, celebrates the 2012 Champions League trophy with players John Terry, Raul Meireles and Jose Bosingwa.

Hide Caption 9 of 11

Photos: Intriguing things owned by Russians around the world International Space Station – A big chunk of the International Space Station belongs to Russia, and is called the Russian Orbital Segment.

Hide Caption 5 of 11

Photos: Intriguing things owned by Russians around the world Skorpios island – Skorpios island in Greece is reportedly owned by Ekaterina Rybolovleva, the daughter of oligarch Dmitry Rybolovlev.

Hide Caption 7 of 11

Photos: Intriguing things owned by Russians around the world Kaspersky Lab – Kaspersky Lab, a Russian computer security company, was co-founded by Eugene Kaspersky and Natalia Kaspersky in 1997.

Photos: Intriguing things owned by Russians around the world Facebook – Russian Internet holding company DST, backed by Russian Yuri Milner, owns around 5% of Facebook shares.

Photos: Intriguing things owned by Russians around the world Waterstones – UK's leading bookseller, Waterstones, is owned by Russian millionaire Alexander Mamut.

Photos: Intriguing things owned by Russians around the world Faberge eggs – Of the 42 surviving Imperial Faberge eggs, 20 belong to Russians.
The lavish jeweled Easter eggs were commissioned from Faberge by Tsar Alexander III in 1885 as Easter gifts for his wife, the Tsarina Maria Feodorovna.
